Field Detail

INDEX_NOT_FOUND

public static final int INDEX_NOT_FOUND
The index value when an element is not found in a list or array: -1. This value is returned by methods in this class and can also be used in comparisons with values returned by various method from List.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

toString

public static java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Object[] array)
Create a string of the array's contents, in the same way that Arrays.toString(Object[]) does but, without enclosing square brackets.

Parameters:
array - array to convert to a string
Returns:
string representation of array

isEquals

public static boolean isEquals(java.lang.String[] array1,
                               java.lang.String[] array2,
                               boolean caseInsensitive)
Returns true if the two specified arrays of String are equal to one another. The two arrays are considered equal if both arrays contain the same number of elements, and all corresponding pairs of elements in the two arrays are equal. Two objects e1 and e2 are considered equal if (e1==null ? e2==null : e1.equals(e2)). In other words, the two arrays are equal if they contain the same elements in the same order. Also, two array references are considered equal if both are null.

Parameters:
array1 - one array to be tested for equality
array2 - the other array to be tested for equality
caseInsensitive - if true, the string arrays are compared without regard to case
Returns:
true if the two arrays are equal

firstStringComplement

public static java.lang.String firstStringComplement(java.lang.String[] superArray,
                                                     java.lang.String[] subArray,
                                                     boolean caseInsensitive)
Returns the first string in subArray that does not exist in superArray. Returns null if there are no complements (ie: subArray is a subset of superArray, in other words, all the strings in subArray exist in superArray.

Parameters:
superArray - array of strings to be searched
subArray - array of strings to find
caseInsensitive - if true, the string arrays are compared without regard to case
Returns:
null if superArray contains subArray, otherwise returns the first string in subArray that does not exist in superArray.

indexOfString

public static int indexOfString(java.lang.String[] array,
                                java.lang.String stringToFind)
Convenience method that calls indexOfString(String[], String, boolean) with a caseInsensitive = true.

Parameters:
array - the array to search through for the object, may be null
stringToFind - the object to find, may be null
Returns:
the index of the object within the array starting at the index, INDEX_NOT_FOUND (-1) if not found or null array input

indexOfString

public static int indexOfString(java.lang.String[] array,
                                java.lang.String stringToFind,
                                boolean caseInsensitive)
Convenience method that calls indexOfString(String[], String, boolean, int) with a startIndex of 0.

Parameters:
array - the array to search through for the object, may be null
stringToFind - the object to find, may be null
caseInsensitive - if true, the strings are compared without regard to case
Returns:
the index of the object within the array starting at the index, INDEX_NOT_FOUND (-1) if not found or null array input

indexOfString

public static int indexOfString(java.lang.String[] array,
                                java.lang.String stringToFind,
                                boolean caseInsensitive,
                                int startIndex)

Finds the index of the given object in the array starting at the given index.

This method returns INDEX_NOT_FOUND (-1) for a null input array.

A negative startIndex is treated as zero. A startIndex larger than the array length will return INDEX_NOT_FOUND (-1).

Parameters:
array - the array to search through for the object, may be null
stringToFind - the object to find, may be null
caseInsensitive - if true, the strings are compared without regard to case
startIndex - the index to start searching at
Returns:
the index of the object within the array starting at the index, INDEX_NOT_FOUND (-1) if not found or null array input

zeroArray

public static void zeroArray(double[] array)
Set all array elements to zero.

Parameters:
array - array to zero

count

public static double count(boolean[] array)
Return the number of true elements in array.

Parameters:
array - boolean array
Returns:
number of true elements in array.

transpose

public static java.lang.Object[][] transpose(java.lang.Object[][] array)
Transpose a 2D Object[][] array. eg: {0,1,2},{3,4,5} becomes {0,3},{1,4},{2,5}.

Parameters:
array - array to transpose
Returns:
transposed array

transpose

public static double[][] transpose(double[][] array)
Transpose a 2D double[][] array. eg: {0,1,2},{3,4,5} becomes {0,3},{1,4},{2,5}.

Parameters:
array - array to transpose
Returns:
transposed array
